qas.question: Where was Kerry's boat on Dec 2-3, 1968?

answers.text: near a peninsula north of Cam Ranh Bay

qas.question: How many crew were with Kerry?

answers.text: in the left arm above the elbow

context: During the night of December 2 and early morning of December 3, 1968, Kerry was in charge of a small boat operating <a0_0>near a peninsula north of Cam Ranh Bay<a0_0/> together with a Swift boat (PCF-60). According to Kerry and the <a1_0>two<a1_0/> crewmen who accompanied him that night, <a2_0>Patrick Runyon and William Zaladonis<a2_0/>, they surprised a group of Vietnamese men unloading sampans at a river crossing, who began running and failed to obey an order to stop. As the men fled, Kerry and his crew opened fire on the <a3_0>sampans<a3_0/> and destroyed them, then rapidly left. During this encounter, Kerry received a shrapnel wound <a4_0>in the left arm above the elbow<a4_0/>. It was for this injury that Kerry received his first Purple Heart Medal.
